customers are doing this is performance and reliability and security flexibility

each of these more often as we go through the talk today now here's a

they cross the enterprise and there's a
quote by their director of IT forgot the animation on that slide so

initiated a contractual agreement to build every all of their IT systems on

worked but the amazing thing about this story is that when they sold their
businesses they were then literally able to just hand over the keys here's the IT
property it's yours so that's how important it was to be able to insulate
and encapsulate all their IT operations into AWS now if you ask ok why would
people want to run Windows on AWS the short answer is that we've shown over
and over again that we are committed to customer success customers are running
Windows workloads on AWS for several important reasons I touched on them and here's a short list the security and
reliability is very important we have 99.95 available la's available in each
of our region's we offer performance and experience there is no compression
algorithm for experience we've been in the cloud now for 10 years we also have
the scale the ability to scale up but also down instantly scaling down a test

bullets are touching on the the security and layers approach that we take what
the security and layers approach is about is that we AWS is responsible for securing the security security of the
cloud and you're responsible for the security in the cloud the applications that you deploy etc so just touching on
a couple of these things we provide secure API access all of our services all of the AWS web services have AP is
that have HTTPS endpoints so you're always going through is making a secure call and they as far as compliance goes
all of these api calls are being logged and tracked with our cloud trail service
for your so everything in your account is being monitored for you to audit in
terms of reliability you can rapidly and
predictably commission your entire infrastructure farms with our cloud formation service or with our AP is the
ec2 service level agreement as i mentioned is 99.95 availability for each
region so that's the reliability that you're looking for with our auto scaling service and our elastic load balancing
service you'll find that these married together really well for especially for web applications with iis and asp net so
here's the beauty of this you have the elastic load balancer in front of a web form of front-end web servers and those
are in an auto scaling group so those can expand and contract as needed all
instantly but the elastic load balancer can automatically pick those up and say well this server has not responded for a
moment so I'm taking that out of the rotation for some reason that server may have died but now the traffic is picking
up based on cpu load or network metrics that you put in or time of day schedule you can say at this time of day i want
to add 10 more servers to the front end web servers and those are automatically added into the elastic load balancer for
round robin or weighted round robin traffic balancing now in terms of high
performance we have as matt woods mentioned in the previous talk we have over 30 instance types a very large
family of instance types so you can optimize for CPU or network or memory as
you choose your instance types you want to base them on the type of workload that you have for example for sequel server you would choose our high large
amount of memory instance types also with AWS Direct Connect which was
mentioned in the previous talk you can literally make your AWS resources and your AWS data center your virtual
private cloud in AWS look exactly like an extension of your data center so
let's say today that your data center is full and you've been given a new project to build out a sister data center or a

am I going to set up the infrastructure for low-latency I need some way some of these applications may be having a need

direct connect service between your on-premise facility and your AWS resources so now you have the ability to

looked just like your the traffic that's overflowing from your current data center so that's really powerful and

az's all regions have at least two and some have three or 4a region is a

grids etc and network backbone so that you have high availability the
